title: What are some rock songs that name a lot of other bands? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the Rap world, this is done on a regular basis. It’s called a Diss Track. You think the Rock band’s could learn a thing or two from them! Well actually the Rockers scored first, and often. It’s just not a big deal to them. Today’s stars know how to drop bombs, no doubt. But they learned from the best. “Your So Vain” - Carly Simon Always loved this one. But gotta admit, the fact that the identity of the ‘perpetrator’ is still unknown just makes it all the more better. Is it Mick, who sang backgrounds on the track? Or Warren Beatty, as we all originally suspected? Somebody even said it was Cat Stevens. Can’t imagine him with an apricot scarf! “How Do You Sleep” - John Lennon Following the Beatles break-up, McCartney’s LP “Ram” has a track ‘Too Many People’, which some say was a barb against Yoko Ono’s involvement with John. In Lennon’s “How Do You Sleep” he gave back as well as received, and then some. Cryptic and pointed, everybody knew what it was about. You would’ve thought they were married! “Sweet Home Alabama” - Lynyrd Skynrd As an answer to Neil Young’s “Southern Man”, Ronnie Van Zant proudly sang about Southern life and culture. And while it did become a big deal, sort of. Young and Van Zant would become good friends up until Ronnie’s passing several years later. “Death on Two Legs” - Queen No! Not Freddie too.. Yes, even Mercury the anointed one can have a barb up his *** once in awhile. Written about Queen manager Norman Sheffield. If you saw ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’ you know all about it. If you didn’t, Sheffield is blamed for a lot of things that went wrong with Freddie and the band. But he did put them in a position to become world-famous, something that Freddie would later regret. “Go Your Own Way” - Fleetwood Mac Buckingham’s response to his break-up with Stevie Nicks. Fleetwood Mac might not have written the book on checking, but they sure contributed a few chapters during the turbulent Seventies. “Sorrow Will Come In The End” - Morrissey Is it true this happened a decade after the demise of ‘The Smiths’? Morrissey and Johnny Marr were sued by ex-drummer Mike Joyce and lost! At least they got a cool track out of it! “Sorrow” became so controversial, it was removed from all future U.K. pressings. “Play With Fire” - The Rolling Stones When I was a kid, we were told this was Mick’s diss on The Beatles. Now I’m told it’s about a high society girl and her rich parents. That probably seems correct, but who knows? Are the Stones playing this song live again? Dunno, but it’s a great song!

Monterey  - The Animals - 1967   This song is about the Monterey Pop Festival held in Monterey, California in 1967 Monterey - The Animals ( Eric Burdon, Weider, Jenkins, McCulloch, Briggs) The people came and listenedSome of them came and playedOthers gave flowers awayYes they did Down in Monterey Young gods smiled upon the crowdTheir music being born of loveChildren danced night and dayReligion was being bornDown in Monterey The Byrds and The AirplaneDid flyOh, Ravi Shankar'sMusic made me cry The Who explodedInto violent light, yeahHugh Masekela's musicWas black as night The Grateful DeadBlew everybody's mindJimi Hendrix, babyBelieve meSet the world on fire, yeah! His majestyPrince Jones smiled as he (Refering to Brian Jonesof the The Rolling Stones)Moved among the crowdTen thousand electric guitarsWere groovin' real loud, yeah If you wanna find the truth in lifeDon't pass music byAnd you knowI would not lieNo, I would not lieNo, I would not lieDown in Monterey Three days of understandingOf moving with one anotherEven the cops grooved with usDo you believe me?Yeah! Down in Monterey______________________________________________ The South's Gonna Do It (again) - The Charlie Daniels Band - 1974  The South’s Gonna Do It (Again) – The Charlie Daniels Band Well, the train to Grinderswitch is runnin' right on timeAnd the Tucker Boys [The Marshall Tucker Band] are cookin' down in CarolinePeople down in Florida can't be still When ol' Lynyrd Skynyrd's pickin' down in JacksonvillePeople down in Georgia come from near and farTo hear Richard Betts [The Allman Brothers Band] pickin' on that red guitar So gather 'round, gather 'round childrenGet down, well just get down childrenGet loud, well you can be loud and be proudWell you can be proud, hearBe proud you're a rebel'Cause the South's gonna do it again Elvin Bishop's sittin' on a bale of hayHe ain't good lookin', but he sure can playAnd there's ZZ Top and you can't forgetThat old brother [Wet] Willie's gettin' soakin' wetAnd all the good people down in TennesseeAre diggin' Barefoot Jerry and The C.D.B. [The Charlie Daniels Band] Also: What are some songs whose lyrics mention other musicians by name?
